author: wsjcom
title: The FBI’s Andrew McCabe Retired; He Didn’t Resign
text:
Your editorial “Cleaning Up Comey’s FBI” (Jan. 30) mischaracterizes FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe’s departure from the FBI. He did not resign. He requested and received permission to take his earned (not “given”) annual/sick leave and apply it to the two-plus months he has until he reaches the minimum retirement age (50, with 20 years of creditable service) in March of this year. This is done routinely in the federal law-enforcement community and is known as “terminal leave.” Words matter, especially with respect to the facts of this important story.
...
